job_title: Treatment Coordinator II in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: Higher pay for clinicians relative to other similar jobs in the area
cons: No cons to speak of

review_title: Doing Work That Isn’t Your Job Description
job_title: Unit Secretary in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: Friendly staff and co-workers and advancement within the company.
cons: Hired a year ago as a Unit Secretary and I only do this job description half the time. The other half I am told to watch unstable and or volatile patients for 12 hours straight without cares or breaks. I was hired to be a unit secretary not a babysitter. This is the job description of a Patient Care Technician. Not paid more nor do they care, as it goes against HR, Compliance and Ethics at times.

job_title: HIM Clerk in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: Was willing to work around school schedule.
cons: No cons at this time.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Good benefits, smaller hospital setting-which I prefer, had some great coworkers, phones provided during shift were great for communication. Direct management was good.
cons: Unsafe patient ratios. Never felt I was able to prioritize patient safety.

review_title: Great Coworkers but many Cons with the facility/company
job_title: Critical Care Registered Nurse in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros:
The teamwork is great
You will have very sick patients most days.
You will learn a lot of skills.
Very diverse patient population.
ICU MD/NP are great.
cons:
There could be better leadership, starting with the charge nurses and going all the way to the directors of the facility. 
Very high turnover with nurses, management will attribute it to being in a military town, it's not true. 
The company will not fight to keep it's experienced nurses/nurses who have been with the company for years.
Very low pay for the job and expectations, raises given did cover for inflation. 
Career ladder program and 401k match are not very good and I have seen much better ones with previous hospitals.
New grads are hired in which is nice but in large numbers, overall the experienced nurses are few and far between.
Moral amongst the unit sways almost weekly at times.
If you

review_title: Extremely poor quality of care and benefits
job_title: Registered Nurse in Pensacola, FL
pros: They pay more than other area hospitals
cons: Management only cares about bottom line. Most of Administration cares nothing for their employees. They leave staff positions open literally for years. Call positions sometimes require endless call during the week and 24 hour call for multiple weekends in a row because they do not hire enough nurses Surgeons refuse to do surgery on patients even when there is a clear need by imaging but they will dispute the reading and patients die. Some surgeons refuse to address uncontrolled postoperative pain in many instances and also do not return pages from radiologists of critical results,, resulting in the death of patients. I could continue but anyone reading this gets the gist. Would never recommend working here but especially would never want to be a patient here.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN Charge in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: Good bennifits, decent ratios, management that actively listens.
cons: A high staff turnover at this time

review_title: Okay starting spot for StaRN, but there's better. If you can handle HCA, you can handle anything after that.
job_title: RN BSN in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: No mandates, highest pay in the region, frexible with PRN, can pick up extra shifts
cons: No extra pay for BSN or Masters, Micromanagement through the roof, often understaffed, the patient and family are always right even if they are poor historians. Basically, everything in HCA is about customer service and you have to kiss some serious a $ $

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fort Walton Beach, FL

job_title: Health Information Management Clerk in Fort Walton Beach, FL

job_title: Staff RN in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros:
The pay is decent compared to other hospitals in the area
Flexibility with shifts
cons:
It is extremely micromanaged.... 
It isn't team oriented and to them you are just a number. I haven't met one person that says they actually like their job. On days off management calls and asks to pick up more days. 
Training isn't good either. I never got a proper orientation and neither did a lot of the staff. High turn-over rate.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Walton Beach, FL

cons: Short Staffed in almost every department

job_title: Phlebotomist in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: medical experience is the only pro
cons: poor management, rude nurses, and disorganized hospital

job_title: Nurse Manager in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: Co-workers are great, corporate tuition reimbursement, growing facility to help improve opportunity to the community for improved healthcare.
cons: Administration not engaged in building leaders more likely to promote to use as scapegoat, good ole boy mentality, high turn-over in all areas leads to poor staffing and lack of educational opportunities for eager staff.  Recruitment process takes to long and poor pay makes it hard to get high performance employees.

review_title: You won't regret working in the Dietary Dept here.
job_title: Food and Nutrition Supervisor in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: You have an excellent opportunity to learn new skills and work with a great bunch of people. The Director keeps the place moving and makes it fun at the same time. I highly recommend working here.
cons: I can't think of any. I enjoyed my time there. Kevin and Sherry kept it lively and there was always something going on in the cafe. The RD's are the nicest group of people you would ever hope to meet.

review_title: Horrible, understaffed, unsafe ratios, no management
job_title: RN, Bsn in Niceville, FL
pros: I don't have a lot of Pros about FWBMC. The staff I work with were very nice. The ER is always in need of qualified personnel especially night shift. Good experience for new nurses patient acuity level is high.
cons: FWBMC is a very poorly run facility. They offer minimal pay no bonuses and little chance for advancement. They have unsafe working conditions in that they are severely understaffed. Every night I worked I felt my license was on the line.

review_title: I love working here, we have a great team of nurses on our unit, Surgical Care Unit.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: There is a great team of nurses on our unit, we work great together, peer interviews work. Great unit director and manager that will do anything for you and work with your schedules to try to make everyone happy.
cons: No pay increases for PRN staff regardless of years of experience, and the base rate is the same if you have 1 year of experience or 10 years.

review_title: Great people in ICU could really use a major computer system update, found more time spent on computer than with patient
job_title: ICU RN in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: People good to work with, best when help was needed
cons: computer system is terrible and needs a major renovation, or new system  time away from work made my life burdensome

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Walton Beach, FL
pros: supervisors and direct management very caring and supportive of staff and try to allow an equal work life balance, okay
cons: Cafeteria is old, floor plan is ancient, only one person working in the morning so same person is serving food and is the cashier. Bathrooms with one toilet
